alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:27AM EST until January 15 at 4:16PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Richland, Calhoun and Lexington Counties. Saluda River At Chappells affecting Greenwood, Saluda and Newberry Counties. Pee Dee River At Cheraw affecting Marlboro and Chesterfield Counties. Stevens Creek Near Modoc affecting Edgefield and McCormick Counties. Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Fairfield, Kershaw and Lancaster Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. Enoree River At Whitmire affecting Union and Newberry Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Congaree River at Carolina Eastman. * WHEN...From early this morning to Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding occurs in low lying areas of the Carolina Eastman Facility and at the Congaree National Park. At 119.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs in the Congaree National Park. Some area farmland is flooded. Minor flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility. At 124.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility with some access roads flooded. Extensive farmland flooding occurs in the area. At 126.0 feet, Extensive farmland and lowland flooding will occur south of Columbia to Lake Marion. Water reaches the top of some dikes at the Carolina Eastman Facility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:43 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 117.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 115.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:43 AM EST Wednesday was 117.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 124.1 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 115.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 530 PM EST.
